column4: Oh damn... "Dell Precision M6500 Laptop has been  awarrded status of Certified on Ubuntu 64-Bit PC" .... and I just cannot get my WiFi to work out of the box Q_Q
Broadcom bcm43xx just plain old fails on all install options so far
And no possibility of connecting laptop to cable (ethernet) at all, only tethering through Wifi through phone available in my area atm
i have bcm4318E and wifi worked out of the box for me
Funny, cause it worked fine in 10.04
Exactly, first time I have had issues with it
InstallArchives() failed is listed when I activate the driver
never had that, everything woked well here from 10.10
That's my biggest issue of trying to get this fixed -- everyone else seemt o NOT have this issue (it is, as I said, listed as being fixced for 10.10)
If you mean you can't ad hoc with your phone to get internet on your laptop. I'm with ye! ad hoc fails
Do you have the dnsmasq package insalled?
I did do a full dhcp servor
Some people recommend just getting a good old fashioned ndiswrapper install going
DITTO check the fricken chat log

Wow sorry Mr. fairly annoyed. I am not concentrating on solving your problems for I have enough of my own at the moment. I just tossed a few innocent suggestions at you, and I do apologise for annoying you by aparrently sounding like an echo of suggestions past. Tsch.
I was actually throwing suggestions for you also
I tend to catch what is sent with my name on it (so it highlights)
